required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study To Assess The Effect Of Gabapentin, Diphenhydramine And Morphine On Cold Pain In Healthy Male Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Double-Blind, Double-Dummy, Placebo And Active Controlled, 4-Way Crossover Methodology Study To Assess The Effect Of Gabapentin, Diphenhydramine And Morphine On Cold Pain In Healthy Male Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: Human experimental pain models are useful in understanding the mechanisms underlying clinical pain conditions and can be used to test the analgesic efficacy of drugs used in the management of pain. Once established these models can be used as mechanism biomarkers in early development clinical studies to establish proof of mechanism for novel compounds. The cold pain model is a mechanistic pain biomarker with potential application in proof of mechanism studies. In this study we aim to set up this cold pain model at a Clinical Research Unit and demonstrate we can effectively screen subjects for this model and examine the effect of morphine, diphenhydramine, and gabapentin in the cold pain model.

primary_outcome.measure: Average Pain (0-120 Seconds): Cold Pain Test Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
primary_outcome.description: Area under the cold pain test Visual Analog Scale (VAS) time curve (AUCcpt 0 to 120 seconds [sec]) averaged over the 120 sec for each time point assessed. Participant adjusted 100 millimeter (mm) electronic VAS with range of "no pain" (0) to "maximum pain" (100) at the anchor endpoints of the scale and "moderate pain" at the midpoint. Pain reported while non-dominant hand was placed in thermostatically controlled water bath at 2±1°C for a maximum of 120 sec.
Interpolated average pain (0 to 8 hours): area under the curve (AUC) of average pain (0 to 120 seconds) recorded at each of the time points taken over 8 hour time period divided by 8.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Findings in Vital Signs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose, Day 1, Day 2 each treatment period, follow-up visit (at least 7 days after last dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Supine blood pressure measured to nearest millimeter of mercury (mmHg), pulse rate measured with automated device or manually in the brachial/radial artery for at least 30 seconds.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Abnormal Findings on Physical Examination
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and follow-up visit (at least 7 days after last dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Full physical examination consisting of an examination of the abdomen, cardiovascular systems, lungs, lymph nodes, mouth, musculoskeletal and neurological systems, skin, extremities, head, ears, eyes, nose, throat and thyroid gland.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Findings on Electrocardiogram (ECG)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose and follow-up visit (at least 7 days after last dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Standard 12-lead ECG performed after subject had rested quietly for at least 10 minutes in a supine position.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Haematology, Clinical Chemistry, Urinalysis Results
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, follow-up visit (at least 7 days after last dosing)
secondary_outcome.description: Standard haematology, clinical chemistry, and urinalysis safety laboratory tests.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Cardiac Monitoring Results
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose through duration of IV infusion dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Continuous cardiac monitoring during intervenous (IV) infusion dosing (morphine or placebo).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Pulse Oxymetry Results
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Predose through duration of IV infusion dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Pulse oxymetry to monitor percentage of hemoglobin saturated with oxygen during intervenous (IV) infusion dosing (morphine or placebo).

intervention.description: Placebo formulations (Capsule, tablet, IV to match the active treatments and to be administered in a double-dummy fashion).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male volunteers having given consent to participate in the study who have no clinically significant anomalies and whose vital signs are within normal range.
- Subject having performed the cold pain test reproducibly ie, if the area under the pain-time curve (AUC) must be within 20% during successive tests within one cold pain test screening visit and within 30% between the two cold pain test screening visits.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject who have had a serious adverse reaction or significant hypersensitivity to any of the study drugs.
- Subjects with a history of or evidence of any neurological condition which could affect pain sensation.
- Subjects with an AUCcpt 0-120 sec in the cold pain test of <1000 in any of the screening tests (excluding familiarization).

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Prior to entering the treatment phases of the study, participants were required to successfully pass cold pain screening tests. Twenty participants were randomized and 19 participants received treatment consisting of a crossover sequence of 4 study drugs administered in sequence I, II, III or IV.

group.title: Placebo, Morphine, Diphenhydramine, Gabapentin
group.description: Placebo (capsules, tablet and intravenous (IV) first, then morphine 10 mg IV, then diphenhydramine 50 mg tablet, then gabapentin 1200 mg capsule.

group.title: Morphine, Gabapentin, Placebo, Diphenhydramine
group.description: Morphine 10 mg intravenous (IV) first, then gabapentin 1200 mg capsule, placebo (capsules, tablet and IV), then diphenhydramine 50 mg tablet.

group.title: Gabapentin, Diphenhydramine, Morphine, Placebo
group.description: Gabapentin 1200 mg capsule first, then diphenhydramine 50 mg tablet, then morphine 10 mg intravenous (IV), then placebo (capsules, tablet and IV).

group.title: Diphenhydramine, Placebo, Gabapentin, Morphine
group.description: Diphenhydramine 50 mg tablet first, then placebo (capsules, tablet and intravenous (IV), then gabapentin 1200 mg capsule, then morphine 10 mg IV.

group.title: Entire Study Population
group.description: Includes all participants who initiated in any treatment sequence

outcome.title: Average Pain (0-120 Seconds): Cold Pain Test Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
outcome.description: Area under the cold pain test Visual Analog Scale (VAS) time curve (AUCcpt 0 to 120 seconds [sec]) averaged over the 120 sec for each time point assessed. Participant adjusted 100 millimeter (mm) electronic VAS with range of "no pain" (0) to "maximum pain" (100) at the anchor endpoints of the scale and "moderate pain" at the midpoint. Pain reported while non-dominant hand was placed in thermostatically controlled water bath at 2±1°C for a maximum of 120 sec.
outcome.population: Participants for analysis = participants who completed all of the four treatment periods.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Oral and IV doses to match active treatments

measure.title: Average Pain (0-120 Seconds): Cold Pain Test Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
measure.description: Area under the cold pain test Visual Analog Scale (VAS) time curve (AUCcpt 0 to 120 seconds [sec]) averaged over the 120 sec for each time point assessed. Participant adjusted 100 millimeter (mm) electronic VAS with range of "no pain" (0) to "maximum pain" (100) at the anchor endpoints of the scale and "moderate pain" at the midpoint. Pain reported while non-dominant hand was placed in thermostatically controlled water bath at 2±1°C for a maximum of 120 sec.
measure.population: Participants for analysis = participants who completed all of the four treatment periods.

analysis.groups_desc: Pre-dose; mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual. Sample sizing calculated based on results from previous methodology studies performed using the same cold pain test; primary criteria was ability to detect a significant gabapentin effect over placebo.
Pre-dose; mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
Pre-dose; mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
1 hour post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
1 hour post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
1 hour post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
1.5 hours post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
1.5 hours post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
1.5 hours post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
2 hours post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
2 hours post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
2 hours post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
4 hours post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
4 hours post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
4 hours post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
8 hours post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
8 hours post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.
8 hours post-dose: mixed effect model with random subject effect, fixed period and treatment effects and random subject-by-visit effect as residual.

outcome.title: Interpolated Average Pain (0-8 Hours)
outcome.description: Interpolated average pain (0 to 8 hours): area under the curve (AUC) of average pain (0 to 120 seconds) recorded at each of the time points taken over 8 hour time period divided by 8.
outcome.population: Participants for analysis = participants who completed all of the four treatment periods.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Findings in Vital Signs
outcome.description: Supine blood pressure measured to nearest millimeter of mercury (mmHg), pulse rate measured with automated device or manually in the brachial/radial artery for at least 30 seconds.
outcome.time_frame: Predose, Day 1, Day 2 each treatment period, follow-up visit (at least 7 days after last dosing)
outcome.population: Safety population: all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Although individual listing data for vital signs were collected, summary statistics were not generated for this outcome measure.

reported_events.desc: Safety population: all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study medication. An Adverse Event (AE) term may be reported as both a serious and non-serious AE, but are distinct events. AE may = serious for 1 subject and = non-serious for another subject or subject may have experienced both a serious and non-serious episode of the same event.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Oral and IV doses to match active treatments

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
